author: Janet Hook
title: What the Texas Primaries Tell Us About November
text:
The Texas primaries on Tuesday didn’t produce any major upsets but did offer a few surprises that shed some insight into broader lessons about mood of the electorate and each party’s strengths and weaknesses heading into November’s midterms. Some takeaways from the first state to hold primaries in the 2018 cycle:
Democrats are surging, but not enough to turn this red state blue. 

Democratic... RELATED VIDEO Can the Democrats Ride a Blue Wave to Midterm Election Wins? The Democrats have a "blue wave" of momentum building for the 2018 midterms, thanks to a motivated base, success in special elections and a low approval rating for President Trump. Will that be enough to take back the House and the Senate? To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
